task.title: Adjusting Posted Invoices
task.abstract: Invoices are adjusted to account for several reasons, including late fees, loyalty discounts, and refunds. Adding adjustments to posted invoices create adjusting entries in order for the income statement and balance sheet to report the change; adjusting entries almost always involve both a balance sheet account and an income statement account. Invoice lines cannot be added to paid invoices.

step.cmd: Select the invoice needing adjustment via the Invoices tab in the eBusiness app.
Navigate to the Invoice Lines related list and click the New Invoice Line button.
Select the Item to adjust using the lookup and enable Price Override.
Enter the adjusted price in the Sale Price field and select the Is Adjustment checkbox.
step.info: Best practices recommend identifying an Adjustment Reason.

step.cmd: Select the Is Posted checkbox and click Save.

taskbody.result: The adjustment line is posted in the Invoice Line related list, adjusting entries are generated for reporting purposes, and the Adjustments field on the Invoice record populates with the sum of the value of related invoice line's Total field. Multiple adjustments can be made to an Invoice. The "Is Adjustment" field must be checked on each Invoice Line record.
